main.helpers

Class RecordHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.helpers.RecordHelper

  • public final class RecordHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    The Record Helper class, this is the class where I've put all the calculations and code to manipulate the records in the visitor. I'm not 100% in love with the name of the class but it will do for now.
    Since:
    2016-07-11
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Victor Procure

    • Method Detail

      • processSale

        public static java.math.BigDecimal processSale(VestRecord vestRecord,
                               MarketPriceRecord marketPriceRecord)
        The process sale method will calculate the total gain from the stocks that were sold. In order to calculate this it will take the current market price available and subtract the original grant price of the stock units. This will get the gain price, this is then used a multiplier to calculte total gain. Rounding is done HALF_UP.
        Parameters:
        vestRecord - This is the original main.record that represents the vested amount
        marketPriceRecord - This is the current market price
        Returns:
        BigDecimal Returns the total gain calculated

      • getMarketPrice

        public static MarketPriceRecord getMarketPrice(VestRecord vestRecord,
                               java.util.TreeSet<MarketPriceRecord> marketPriceRecords)
        This method will return the market price closest to the vested amount, this is a future use stub that I left in while experimenting with some calculations. Works correctly for client request, but may need to be looked at for future correctness.
        Parameters:
        vestRecord - This is the main.record of current vested stock, that we need to lookup market price for
        marketPriceRecords - This is the set of all market prices in our data
        Returns:
        MarketPriceRecord Returns the closest Market Price to the date of the vested records

      • getRecentSale

        public static SaleRecord getRecentSale(VestRecord vestRecord,
                       java.util.TreeSet<SaleRecord> saleRecords)
        The get recent sale method returns the sale closest to the date of a given vested stock option. This is used to correctly calculate the sales and performance records later.
        Parameters:
        vestRecord - The vested option we are looking for a sale of
        saleRecords - The set of all sales
        Returns:
        SaleRecord Will return a null if no sale found within date criteria

      • getPerformanceMultiplier

        public static float getPerformanceMultiplier(VestRecord vestRecord,
                             java.util.TreeSet<PerformanceRecord> performanceRecords)
        As an employee may have multiple performance records added we use this to find all the performance records that have a date greater than the vested option date. This eliminates the possibility of having a performance bonus applied to options that happen after the bonus is given.
        Parameters:
        vestRecord - This is the vested option we are looking for performance bonuses for
        performanceRecords - The set of all performance records
        Returns:
        float Returns the multiplier to use against all vested units

      • getPerformanceMultiplier

        public static float getPerformanceMultiplier(PerformanceRecord performanceRecord,
                             float currentMultiplier)
        The get performance multiplier method will return the current mutliplier to use. Helping create the aggregate of all multipliers.
        Parameters:
        performanceRecord - The performance main.record we are adding to our multiplier aggregate
        currentMultiplier - The current multiplier
        Returns:
        float Returns the new multiplier aggregate

      • getVestValue

        public static java.math.BigDecimal getVestValue(VestRecord vestRecord,
                                MarketPriceRecord marketPriceRecord,
                                float multiplier)
        The get Vest Value method returns the total value of the vested option based on the given market price and any performance multipliers
        Parameters:
        vestRecord - The vested option main.record we are running calculations against
        marketPriceRecord - The current market price main.record
        multiplier - The performance multiplier to use
        Returns:
        BigDecimal Returns the vested option value, will never be negative 0.00 is the lowest
